data.title: Change Zoom / font size on a per window basis
data.body:
Currently zooming in on multiple windows affects all windows, not just the active one.
Would be nice to see this changed - I use 2 different screen sizes, so gets a bit annoying at the best of times. 

- VSCode Version: 1.9.0
- OS Version: macOS Sierra

Steps to Reproduce:

1. CMD+

data.title: Powershell is the default and the only terminal from VSCode when using the new 1.9.0 version of vscode.
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9.0
- OS Version: Win 10

I upgraded to the new version of VS Code and found it astonishing that it forces me to use powershell !! Why dont we have an option to use command prompt? Why would you ever want powershell to be the default.

data.title: Markdown preview doesn't fill editor
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.0
- OS Version: MacOS Sierra 10.12.1
  - 15.4" (2880x1800)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open Markdown Preview (or Release Notes/Extension)

Notes: 
- Relative amount of space it doesn't fill in
- Unaffected by anything other state of the app (other files open, split editor, panel open, resolution of monitor, etc.)
- Noticed in previous two versions of vscode
- The `<object></object>` fills in completely but its embedded content does not.

When I read over the release notes I noticed the gif of the markdown synch had the preview fill entire screen and realized it's been not completely filled on mine since I started using it. whoops ¯\_(ツ)_/¯ 

![screen shot 2017-02-02 at 03 49 56 pm 3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3842798/22567793/578c7354-e95f-11e6-8966-f67358424fd4.png)
![screen shot 2017-02-02 at 03 49 56 pm 2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3842798/22567794/57983518-e95f-11e6-89a0-5a4512b3d57e.png)

User Settings:

```json
// Place your settings in this file to overwrite the default settings
{
    "editor.fontFamily": "'Fira Code', Consolas, 'Courier New', monospace",
    "editor.fontSize": 14,
    "editor.fontLigatures": true,
	"editor.renderWhitespace": "boundary",
	"editor.trimAutoWhitespace": true,
	"eslint.autoFixOnSave": true,
	"eslint.validate": [
		"javascript",
		"javascriptreact"
	],
	"npm-intellisense.importQuotes": "\"",
	"npm-intellisense.packageSubfoldersIntellisense": true,
	"files.associations": {"*.example":"jsx","*.html":"handlebars"}
,
"window.zoomLevel": 0,
"vsicons.projectDetection.autoReload": true,
"terminal.integrated.shell.windows": "C:\\Program Files\\Git\\bin\\bash.exe"
}
```
Steps to Reproduce:

1. Attempt to open the integrated terminal with `ctrl` + `` ` ``
2. Observe that it doesn't open, but you do get a warning toaster:
> command 'extension.togglecodeinline' not found

(using `ctrl` + `` ` `` to toggle the terminal _off_ once opened via the palette menu works as expected)

data.title: User settings warnings in workspace settings file do not show immediately after saving
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open work space settings
2. Add a setting which is not supported in workspace. Eg: `"git.path"="somevalue"`
3. Save

Expected: Squiggle (warning) in editor should be shown
Actual: Squiggles are not shown. Shown only after re-opening the editor.

data.title: Find and replace capture group/backreference inserts `undefined` instead of empty string
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.0
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Execute find/replace with regex.
2. Using backreference replacements (e.g. `$1`, `$2`...), if the capture group did not capture anything, VS Code outputs `"undefined"` instead of the expected `""` (empty string).

This just started happening after upgrading to 1.9.0 today (02/02/17) and was not doing this yesterday.

data.title: VSCode freezing/hanging when trying to indent improperly formatted rule in .less file
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9
- OS Version: 10.10.5

Steps to Reproduce:

1. in a .less file, If I paste the following:
color: 'green', fontSize: '22px
into a rule, VSCode completely locks up.
2. I Don't even have time to fix the CSS into the correct format. I was just copying it over from a JSX file.
3. It's weird. 
4. I'm running the Sublime Text Keymap and beautiful extension. But I don't see how that would be related. Neither should be actively doing anything.

data.title: Cannot connect to runtime process
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.9.0 (27240e71ef390bf2d66307e677c2a333cebf75af, 2017-02-02T08:23:30.856Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.4.0
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|TypeScriptImport|kevinmcgowan|1.7.0|
|vscode-exec-node|miramac|0.2.1|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.9.0|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.6.2|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. open a single test.js file, content:
x=1
console.log(x)
x=x+1
console.log(x)

2. press ctrl+r
DEBUG CONSOLE output:
```
node --debug-brk=29725 --nolazy test.js 
Debugger listening on 127.0.0.1:29725
```
Nothing happens. After half a minute:
Cannot connect to runtime process  (reason: connect ETIMEDOUT 127.0.53.53:29725).

Expected behaviour:
test.js is run, 
variable is printed
debugger stops at breakpoint (line 3)

Likely culprit : somehow localhost is resolved as 127.0.53.53 instead of 127.0.0.1 !?!?

data.title: TypeScript language service died unexpectedly 5 times in the last 5 Minutes
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.9.0 (27240e71ef390bf2d66307e677c2a333cebf75af, 2017-02-02T08:31:00.827Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|jshint|dbaeumer|0.10.15|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.2|
|vscode-npm-script|eg2|0.1.8|
|vscode-npm|fknop|3.3.0|
|beautify|HookyQR|0.7.3|
|sp-tools|Mike|0.3.0|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. working in SharePoint WebDav folder -> ` \\Local-SP-Server.com@SSL\DavWWWRoot\SubSite\SiteAssets `

2. When I first open VS Code then open a .js file I receive continuous errors that the Typescript Service has failed (*The TypeScript language service died unexpectedly 5 times in the last 5 Minutes.
RetryClose*). The error pops up continuously until I close the file or VS Code. 

3. Errors will stop after closing the .js file and re-opening it. Once I re-open the .js file i will get the error again, but this time the error message stays at the top of the screen and i can hit escape to clear the error.

4. This also happened in the version of VS Code previous to v1.9.0

   **Sidenote:** 
   I uninstalled the *sp-tools* extension and i'm still having the same issue. Also, I was getting this error before i installed all other extensions listed above.

data.title: Provide a way to theme diff highlights
data.body:
Right now themes cannot determine the colors of the git diff highlight colors meaning that if you want the theme to be readable you *must* select foreground colors that have sufficient contrast on both the green and the red colors.

This image has uses a comment foreground that looks great on the background but is completely unreadable on the light green diff highlight:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/22565594/930ed6e6-e93d-11e6-8120-d82d5ab57b74.png)

Ideally themes would be able to define this color since the color appears within the editor.

data.title: vscode 1.9 breaks my syntax theme.
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.9 - OS Version: macOS Sierra I had a [theme](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=karyfoundation.theme-karyfoundation-themes) which used to be fully colored and it now looks like this: What I did with my theme was I defined [specific token values](https://github.com/karyfoundation/karyfoundation.themeX/blob/master/karyfoundation.themeX/theme.yml) by opening up the developer tools and going through the tokenizer classes. What I see right now is this problem within my themes are caused by the new way you handle these tokens: So what should I do right now? I should dump down my theme right? Remove all the language specific tokens and stick with the basic tmLanguage stuff?

data.title: Default language-specific settings
data.body:
Now that we have language specific settings we should consider enabling default language-specific settings to work around some of the annoyances for particular languages:

**Markdown**: Disable intellisense by default:

```js
"[markdown]": {
"editor.quickSuggestions": false
}
```

**Makefile**: Always use tabs for indentation since spaces are invalid (related: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/4815)

**YAML**: Always use spaces for indentation since tabs are invalid.

data.title: VSCode 1.9.0 breaks MSSQL extension - preview HTML pane never refreshes on
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.0
- OS Version: All

Steps to Reproduce:

A change to editor initialization in VSCode 1.9.0 is breaking the [MSSQL](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=ms-mssql.mssql) extension – any query execution after the 1st time you open a results pane in the WebView is failing to refresh. This means that query execution appears to fail which really is our key experience. Please note this is a breaking change in behavior from previous versions of VSCode.
 
We raised this a couple of days ago as #19654 which was closed with instructions to change our API call. After fixing our code we discovered the problem happens even if when calling the API correctly.
- Previously, calling previewHtml would refresh the page if it already existed. This ensured our page was reloaded so the UI could show new query results. 
- Now, it only refreshes if it goes out of focus and comes back into focus. If it’s the main tab on ViewColumn 2, for example, it’ll never be refreshed.
- This breaks our existing, released extension's behavior.

So this code snippet will open an editor with a WebView component the 1st time it runs, but subsequent calls will never refresh the page.
```
previewCommandPromise = vscode.commands.executeCommand('vscode.previewHtml', resultsUri, resultPaneColumn, paneTitle);
```

The impactful change causing this only went into the main branch 6 days ago in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/releases/tag/translation%2F20172701.01. We believe the change is due to going from side by side to editor groups control: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/commit/0763cc88587eae62eabc98f3e1363f2cee16c1f2.
 
What are the next steps to finding a solution to this? I can imagine we are not the only extension that might be hit by this change. We are looking for a workaround on our side but would appreciate if we can get help on a solution or understand if this could be hotfixed by VSCode.

data.title: [WelcomeUX] Wrongly “unbound” shortcuts in playground
data.body:
Hi,

VSCode 1.9 has a new editor playground that explains the different shortcuts in a prose:

![selection_126](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1730702/22563900/bb9a0578-e982-11e6-9d66-3cf6f0534b00.png)

On the above screenshot, I'm not sure if the sentence “press unbound or unbound” is the expected text in case there are no shortcuts bound for that particular actions or if it is a bug, but that certainly feels weird.

The second point is that I happen to have shortcuts defined for these actions (“add a new cursor above or below”), so there is certainly a bug here.

I'm on Ubuntu, with a French keyboard layout, if that may be of any relevance.

data.title: My extension is ignoring http.proxyStrictSSL config setting
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.0
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.6

My extension, [vscode-cdnjs](https://github.com/Jakobud/vscode-cdnjs) makes various calls to:

```
https://api.cdnjs.com
```

The extension uses the [GOT](https://github.com/sindresorhus/got) http request library. This http request library is essentially a wrapper around the Node.js http/https modules in order to simplify http requests and the data returned.

I have discovered that if a user is behind a proxy, that [they will get certificate errors](https://github.com/Jakobud/vscode-cdnjs/issues/2) when my extension tries to access `https://api.cdnjs.com`. (The user needs to set `strict-ssl=false` when using `npm` as well so it's definitely an issue with their proxy)

They set the VSCode configuration value `"http.proxyStrictSSL": false` but this did not seem to make a difference.

So my question: Why does my extension appear to ignore the `proxyStrictSSL` configuration setting? I would assume that the `GOT` extension is using VSCode's (Electron) Node.js http/https modules under the hood and would therefore obey this setting. But it doesn't seem to be the case.

Also is there a way to reliably verify if an extension is abiding to this setting?

data.title: How to handle empty CodeLenses?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1, 1.9-insiders
- OS Version: All

So the vscode-java extension relies on the Java Language Server to provide CodeLenses to VS Code. We have, as per the language protocol, 2 calls:
- document/codeLens: which lists all the places in the current document that might have references. This calls returns fairly quickly
- codeLens/resolve: will actually compute all references to the given codelens (the ones currently displayed on screen), it's time a consuming operation.

In the case of vscode-java, when no references are found, we return/display `0 references` as a codelens label, which is fairly annoying, as it eats some screen real estate. 

![](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/865769/22558569/24398e7e-e93c-11e6-8cc8-0614cf52fa43.png)

Eagerly resolving codelenses during the `document/codelens` call would help but it is not an option, for performance reasons.

Even returning an empty label adds unnecessary pseudo-lines, moving some code off the screen.

So I was wondering: what's the best way to handle that use case? Is there a way to return special codelenses that would not generate these extra lines, or is this something that could be fixed at the vscode level, i.e, when the codelens label is empty, release that extra space? Or maybe there's another approach?

This relates to  https://github.com/redhat-developer/vscode-java/issues/148

data.title: Trigger willSave even if file is not dirty to support code formatters
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9.x
- OS Version: Windows.

With the introduction of `willSave` events extensions provide code which for example format on save or fix errors on save (eslint, tslint). All these will save participants do nothing if `autoSave` is set to `afterDelay` since the text manipulation could infer with typing. For example a user types `{}`, save kicks in and the linter removed the empty block because it is superfluous.

To still give users a single short cut to trigger all code cleanup actions it would be cool if we can bind these to `Ctrl+S` if `autoSave === delay`. We could do the following: if `autoSave === delay` and the file is saved, trigger `willSave`. If `willSave` changes the document (makes it dirty) save the document and trigger save event. If the document is not dirty after will save do nothing.

@jrieken FYI.

data.title: Is Visual Studio Code eventually going to replace Visual Studio?
data.body:
Is Visual Studio Code eventually going to replace Visual Studio?

It is simple to use, yet powerful.  
Programmers actually like it!

I think if Microsoft should go towards this direction.  Especially if the libraries could be picked and used easily throughout instead of like in Visual Studio where the code breaks at every line as you are typing it (then you have to pick options for that line).

I never liked that Visual studio is not very intuitive.  Visual Studio Code, on the other hand, I welcome using for all my projects because of it's simplicity and the ability to control debuggers better.

data.title: Fedora: @recommended extensions are not showing
data.body:
Install 1.9 stable candidate on Fedora (27240e71ef390bf2d66307e677c2a333cebf75af, 64bit, rpm)

- open a .java file
- dialog opens that recommends you to install the Java extension
- Agree to look at the recommended extensions
- extensions view is empty

- enter 'Java' as search string. Extensions are shown (so the connection seems to work)

Same when picking 'Recommended extensions' from the viewlet menu. All other menu items work.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.3

It would be very beneficial to have extension resources (issues, homepage, repository) available in an uniform way in the app. Most extensions I've tried don't mention these in the details, so you have to go the marketplace to find out.

Examples:

1. https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=msjsdiag.debugger-for-ios-web
Has Issues and repository under resources in the web page. In the app this info is nowhere to be found.

2. https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=pranaygp.vscode-css-peek
Same as with 1)

Information is mostly available, but not in the app.
